content.p: An important part of the metacognitive cycle is being able to assess the task so you know what you will need to do to successfully meet the learning criteria. Let’s look at some body systems you will be studying and most people have a basic knowledge about.
For each of the following sample learning objectives associated with an organ system in this course, assess the level of cognitive process you will most likely be applying:

body.p: Identify the structure and location of the kidneys, ureters, urinary bladder and urethra.

feedback.p: Correct. This includes identifying anatomical parts by description and location.
Incorrect. While you need to be able to identify structures and functions by description, this is not involving analysis of the basic information.

hint.p: This task could be using a coloring book, labeling a drawing or picture, or in lab identifying on models and dissection.

body.p: Visually identify microscopic and macroscopic bone structures.

feedback.p: Correct. This includes identifying anatomical parts on an image or on model and microscope slide.
Incorrect. While you need to be able to identify structures by sight, this is not involving analysis of the basic information.

hint.p: This task could be using a coloring book, labeling a drawing or picture, or in lab identifying on models and dissection.

body.p: Explain the role of the integumentary and muscular system in maintaining temperature homeostasis.

feedback.p: Incorrect. While you have to know the basic functions of the two systems, that alone will not sufficiently address this learning objective.
Correct. You will have to apply not only what you learned about these systems but how they function together to maintain a balance in the body.

body.p: List the cell types and extracellular matrix components in the bone and describe their function.

feedback.p: Correct. This includes naming anatomical parts by description and giving their functions.
Incorrect. While you need to be able to identify structures and functions, this is not involving analysis of the basic information.

content.p: For each of the following sample learning objectives associated with an organ system in this course, assess the level of cognitive process you will most likely be applying:

body.p: Explain how the skeletal system and endocrine system interact for calcium homeostasis.

feedback.p: Incorrect. While you need to know information about the systems involved, this requires you to go beyond facts to application of that information.
Correct. This requires you apply what you have learned about different systems and physiological processes and explain how they work together to maintain balance in the body.

body.p: Trace the path of light through the eye and nerve impulses from the retina to various parts of the brain.

feedback.p: Correct. This sequencing activity is a bit more involved than just randomly identifying parts, but is still a basic level of recall of information you have learned.
Incorrect. While this seems more than recall because you have to put them in correct order, it is still just recalling the parts you have learned.

body.p: Describe in order, from simplest to most complex, the major levels of organization of the integumentary system.

feedback.p: Correct. This is a type of classification task.
Incorrect. While this seems more than recall because you have to put them in correct order, it is still just recalling the descriptions you have learned.

body.p: Describe how a medical professional can use changes in the appearance of the skin to predict certain medical conditions.

feedback.p: Incorrect. While you have to know the basic structure and functions of the skin, that alone will not sufficiently address this learning objective.
Correct. You will have to apply not only what you learned about the skin and its normal function, but describe how that information can be applied.

body.p: Define the joint related terms: aponeuroses, tendons, bursae.

feedback.p: Correct. This is a type of definition task.
Incorrect. While you have to give the definition in your own words, it is still just recalling the facts you have learned.

content.p: For each of the following sample learning objectives associated with an organ system in this course, assess the level of cognitive process you will most likely be applying:

body.p: Distinguish between exocrine and endocrine function of the digestive system cells and relate this to their role in the overall process of digestion.

feedback.p: Incorrect. While you have to know examples of endocrine and exocrine secretions, that alone will not sufficiently address this learning objective.
Correct. While you have to give specific examples you have learned, you will be differentiating and synthesizing this information to explain how they function within the system.

body.p: Identify the cells of the epidermis based on their location and anatomic structure (stem cells of the stratum basale, keratinocytes, melanocytes, Langerhans cells, Merkel cells).

feedback.p: Correct. This objective involves cells in different layers, but is still just using what you have learned about their basic anatomy and physiology.

Incorrect. While this information could help you with a more involved learning objective such as how the skin repairs itself after damage, this is still just learning facts associated with specific parts of the integumentary system.

body.p: Provide examples of how the respiratory system relates to other body systems to maintain homeostasis.

feedback.p: Incorrect. While you have to know the basic functions of the respiratory system, that alone will not sufficiently address this learning objective.
Correct. You will have to interpret not only what you learned about this system but other systems to justify your examples of how they work together to maintain balance in the body.

body.p: Describe the functional classification of articulations, based on degree of movement allowed.

feedback.p: Correct. This is a type of classification task.
Incorrect. While this seems more than recall because you have to sort them by degree of movement, it is still just recalling the facts you have learned.

body.p: Predict the types of problems that would occur in the body if the olfactory system was not functioning normally.

feedback.p: Incorrect. While you have to know the basic functions of the olfactory system, that alone will not sufficiently address this learning objective.

Correct. You will have to apply not only what you learned about this system and its normal function, but make predictions about what will happen to it and other systems if it is not able to function properly.

body.p: Explain how wrinkles and stretch marks are related to the collagen and elastin fibers in the dermis.

feedback.p: Incorrect. While you have to know the basic structure and functions of the skin, that alone will not sufficiently address this learning objective.
Correct. You will have to apply not only what you learned about the skin’s structure and normal function, but describe how they are related to a physiological change that can occur.
